availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John H. Donahew (Powell County, Kentucky, resident and soldier)

body.p: Powell County, Kentucky, resident and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Jacob Donahew and Jane Donahew. Student in Montgomery County, Kentucky, in 1850. Resident of Powell County in 1860. Served in the 4th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from October 9, 1861 to October 30, 1862. Reported as deserted on October 30, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, District 2, p. 63A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Powell County, p. 47.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 654-5.
